title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.1 Early Child Development (ECD): QUALITY HEALTHCARE, NUTRITION, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: 1.1 By 2022, the Health, Nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) service delivery systems provide quality healthcare, nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions for pregnant women and children under 5 from the most vulnerable families, which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Maternal And Newborn Health, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children under 5 in targeted areas benefit from improved access to quality healthcare and nutrition, protection and development opportunities in their home, care and preschool environments.

participating-org.narrative: SOUTH ASIA INFANT FEEDING RESEARCH NETWORK

sector.narrative: Child health policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Diet diversity in early childhood, including complementary feeding, multiple micronutrient powders and lipid-based nutrition supplements
Digital Health and Health Information Systems
Early detection and treatment for children with life-threatening wasting
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
HSS - Health sector policy, planning and governance at national or sub-national levels
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.1 By 2022, the Health, Nutrition and WASH service delivery systems provide quality healthcare, nutrition and WASH interventionsfor pregnant women and children under 5 from the most vulnerable families

description.narrative: UNICEF helped improve the quality of healthcare and nutrition services for pregnant women and children under 5 with (i) over 150,000 children treated using updated protocols for management of severe and acute malnutrition, (ii) 350,000 children duly screened and protected from mother to child transmission of HIV and Syphilis, (iii) more than 40,000 mothers and new-borns received quality care during the antenatal period, time of birth and in the postpartum period. In addition, the formative research on Infant and Young Child Feeding was completed, with the rich findings to be presented to Ministry of Health in 2022. | Status:Met | As-of Date:02/02/2022

title.narrative: Number of health facilities implementing maternal and neonatal health quality improvement (MNH QI) approach(52578), Text
Country achievement of validation for elimination of mother to child transmission of HIV and Syphillis(66672), Text

baseline.value: Score 1: Country preparation for validation for EMTCT of HIV and Syphillis

target.value: 2022:Score 4: The country maintains the EMTCT status

actual.value: 2021:Country achieved the elimination of mother to child transmission of HIV and Syphilis status in 2019 and, based on the revalidation conducted in 2021, declared to be maintaining the status.

title.narrative: Existence of a national multi-sectoral social behaviour change communication strategy for nutrition, health, early stimulation and WASH focusing on the first 1000 days(52580), Text

target.value: 2022:Score 4 (The national protocols for the management of SAM based on WHO standards (2013) have been finalized.)

actual.value: 2021:Formative research on Maternal Infant and Young Child Feeding was completed and the final report was submitted to the Ministry of Health. Final recommendations would be presented and discussed with the MoH at a round table discussion in early January 2022

title.narrative: Existence of national protocols for the management of SAM based on WHO standards (21-05-L3-05), Text

baseline.value: Score 3:The national protocols for the management of SAM based on WHO standards (2013) have been drafted.

target.value: 2022:Score 5 (The national protocols for the management of SAM based on WHO standards (2013) have been finalized and endorsed by the government)

actual.value: 2021:Score 5 National protocol for management of severe and acute malnutrition, based on WHO standards completed, endorsed and nationally scaled up to reach every Medical Office of Health area and every specialist hospital.
